intro: Neotorularia korolkowii, commonly known as the Korolkowii's torularia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions. Neotorularia korolkowii is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
